dbPhase.hypeerweb

Class WebId

  • java.lang.Object
    • dbPhase.hypeerweb.WebId
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<WebId>

    public class WebId
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<WebId>
    The id of a node in the HyPeerWeb.

     Domain:
      id     : int
      height : int
 
 Invariant:
      id ≥ -1 AND
      height ≥ -1 AND
      height ≤ MAX_HEIGHT AND
      (id = -1 OR height = -1) ⇒ this = NULL_WEB_ID) AND
      id ≥ 0 ⇒ height ≥ ⌈log2(id + 1)⌉
      
 -- In other words:
 -- The id must be greater than or equal to 0 and the only webId that can have the id = -1 or height = -1 is the NULL_WEB_ID.
    Author:
    Scott Woodfield

    • Constructor Detail

      • WebId

        public WebId(int id)
        The standard webId constructor that creates a new web id from the given id.
        Parameters:
        id - The value of the new webId.
        Precondition:
        id ≥ 0
        Postcondition:
        this.id = id AND height = locationOfMostSignificantOneBit(id) + 1

      • WebId

        public WebId(int id,
     int height)
        The standard webId constructor that creates a new web id from the given id, and height.
        Parameters:
        id - The value of the new webId.
        height - The height of the new webId.
        Precondition:
        id ≥ 0 AND height >= locationOfMostSignificantOneBit(id) + 1)
        Postcondition:
        this.id = id AND this.height = height

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a binary string representation of this webId.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Precondition:
        None
        Postcondition:
        this = NULL_WEB_ID ⇒ result = "NULL WEB ID" AND
        this ≠ NULL_WEB_ID AND height = 0 ⇒ result = ""
        this ≠ NULL_WEB_ID AND height > 0 ⇒ |result| = height AND result = Integer.valueOf(result, 2)

        Postcondition:
        result = object ≠ null AND
                     object instanceof WebId AND
                     id = object.id AND
                     height = object.height

      • isNeighborOf

        public boolean isNeighborOf(WebId webId)
        Tests whether or not this is a neighbor of the webId.
        Parameters:
        webId - the possible neighbor we are comparing against.
        Precondition:
        webId ≠ null AND
        webId ≠ NULL_WEB_ID AND
        this ≠ NULL_WEB_ID AND
        Postcondition:
        result = this.distanceTo(webId) = 1 AND
        height > webId.height => id > webId.id AND
        height < webId.height => id < webId.id

      • isSurrogateNeighborOf

        public boolean isSurrogateNeighborOf(WebId webId)
        Tests whether or not this is a surrogate neighbor of webId.

        A webId x is the surrogate neighbor of a node y iff
                     x.height + 1 = y.height AND
                     y.toString().charAt(y.toString()-1) = '1' AND -- the high order bit of y is 1. Because the height of x is shorter its corresponding bit is 0.
                     x.distanceTo(y) = 2 -- That is, the bits at location webId.height of x and y differ plus one and only one other bit.
        Parameters:
        webId - The other webId we are going to compare against.
        Precondition:
        webId ≠ null AND
        webId ≠ NULL_WEB_ID AND
        this ≠ NULL_WEB_ID
        Postcondition:
        result = height + 1 = webId.height AND
                     webId.id & webId.highOrderBit ≠ 0 AND
                     (~(-1 << height) & webId.Id) < id AND
                     distanceTo(webId) = 2

      • isFoldOf

        public boolean isFoldOf(WebId webId)
        Tests whether or not this is the fold of webId.
        Parameters:
        webId - The webId we are going to test against.
        Precondition:
        webId ≠ null AND
        webId ≠ NULL_WEB_ID AND
        this ≠ NULL_WEB_ID
        Postcondition:
        result = height = webId.height ⇒ result = (~(-1 << height) & id) = (~(-1 << webId.height) & ~webId.id) AND
                     height + 1 = webId.height + 1 ⇒ result = (~(-1 << height) & id) = (~(-1 << height) & ~webId) AND
                     height = webId.height + 1 ⇒ result = (~(-1 << webId.height) & id) = (~(-1 << webId.height) & ~webId.webId) AND
                     height ≠ webId.height && height + 1 ≠ webId.height && height &ne webId.id + 1 ⇒ result = false )

      • isSurrogateFoldOf

        public boolean isSurrogateFoldOf(WebId webId)
        Tests whether or not this is the surrogate fold to webId.
        Parameters:
        webId - The webId we are going to test against.
        Precondition:
        webId ≠ null AND
        webId ≠ NULL_WEB_ID AND
        this ≠ NULL_WEB_ID
        Postcondition:
        result = height + 1 = webId.height AND
                     webId.id < id AND
                     (~(-1 << height) & webId.id = ~(~(-1 << height) & id)

      • isInverseSurrogateFoldOf

        public boolean isInverseSurrogateFoldOf(WebId webId)
        Tests whether or not this is the inverse surrogate fold to webId.
        Parameters:
        webId - The webId we are going to test against.
        Precondition:
        webId ≠ null AND
        webId ≠ NULL_WEB_ID AND
        this ≠ NULL_WEB_ID
        Postcondition:
        result = height = webId.height + 1 AND
                     id < webId.id AND
                     (~(-1 << webId.height) & webId.id = ~(~(-1 << webId.height) & id)

      • locationOfMostSignificantOneBit

        public static int locationOfMostSignificantOneBit(int id)
        Returns the location of the highest one bit in the id. Normally this method is private but we made it public so we can demonstrate loop testing.
        Parameters:
        id - We will find the location of the highest one bit of this id.
        Precondition:
        id ≥ 0
        Postcondition:
        id = 0 ⇒ result = -1 AND
        id > 0 ⇒ Integer.toBinaryString(id).charAt(result) = '1' AND
                       ∀ result < i < 32 (Integer.toBinaryString(id).charAt(i) = '0')
